page.title: 07Swimming Pool, Manningtree
page.content: You can hear the children shouting and laughing like the gulls at the beach. Inside the children are diving and swimming in the water. Mr Pearce holds a pole out and they line up to dive over it. When the pole goes away the children carry on playing and splashing. Mr Pearce then shouts EVERYONE OUT and the children all bundle for the changing cubicles, still making a row _throwing towels around. When the children have gone, the pool is quiet and still as a millpond, the water ripples in the breeze. By Ian Harwood, 13 years old.
